actions.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Education and Labor.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary and Vocational Education.
House Committee on Education and Labor Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Elementary, Secondary, and Vocational Education

official_title: A concurrent resolution to encourage the State and local governments and local educational agencies to include among the requirements for secondary school graduation a thorough knowledge and understanding of our Nation's founding documents.

summary.text: Encourages State and local governments and local educational agencies to include among the requirements for secondary school graduation a thorough knowledge and understanding of the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution, and the Federalist Papers.

titles.title: A concurrent resolution to encourage the State and local governments and local educational agencies to include among the requirements for secondary school graduation a thorough knowledge and understanding of our Nation's founding documents.
